intro: Weinmannia naiguatensis, commonly known as the Naiguatá weinmannia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in cloud forests, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in a distinctive arrangement. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its mountainous habitat.
